title: Clicking E-sign will trigger a modal asking the user to confirm if they want to proceed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as a club
AND that user can view the Add C widget
custom_steps:
WHEN user selects a Tendered Add C
AND clicks E-sign
custom_expected:
THEN a modal pops up asking the user if they want to proceed
Wireframe: http://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=submit_add_cs_for_e-signature

title: Verify that if both club and player have signed the Addendum C, the C updates to "Pending".
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that a player has signed his Addendum C
AND that THE club has signed his C
custom_steps: WHEN the user returns to the Add C widget
custom_expected: THEN the status of that form is shown as "Pending"

title: Verify E-Signed PDFs should now appear as a paper clip icon in the attachments column on the Addendum C widget.
custom_preconds: GIVEN that a player and club have e-signed an Add C
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the form in the Add C widget
custom_expected: THEN the PDF appears as a paper clip icon in the attachments column

title: Verify Club can click on the icon to bring up the PDF for player to e-sign. After this, the club hands the device over to the player
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user can view the Player E-Signatures widget
custom_expected: THEN the e-sign icon is clickable

title: Verify Player is guided by the Adobe echo sign interface. The player will need to be guided to typing their name and drawing their signature.
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user can view the Player E-Signatures widget
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the e-sign icon
custom_expected: THEN the user is prompted by the Adobe Echosign interface

title: Verify The form now drops off the Player E-signature widget. (Note: The next story makes this an automatic process but for now, its fine to only work on manually refresh)
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user has submitted a selected a player for e-signature from the Player E-Signatures widget
custom_steps: WHEN the user completes the process
custom_expected: THEN the player's name will be dropped from the widget

title: If the stamping was successfully complete, the forms fall off the Club e-signature widget and a notification is shown "x document(s) were successfully E-Signed"
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has e-signed multiple forms
custom_steps: WHEN the user stamps the club signature on them
custom_expected:
THEN the forms fall off the Club E-signature widget
AND a notification appears: "x document(s) were successfully E-Signed"

title: Verify that if PDF is withdrawn pen icon reverts to upload icon
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user has edited a form in e-sign state
AND saved
AND the warning modal appears
AND the user clicks "Ignore and Continue"
custom_expected: THEN the status icon reverts to the upload icon

title: Verify When an addendum C is e-signed and approved, A BOC stamp is included at the bottom of the pdf
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User is logged into BOC
AND User looks for Tendered Addendum Cs
AND sends Addendum C to esign
AND Addendum C is esigned
custom_steps: WHEN BOC checks Uploaded Addendum C from esign
custom_expected: THEN Show BOC stamp at bottom of page that includes "For Commissioners office use only", "Approved and recorded", "By commissioner of Baseball" and the signature "Roy Krasik "designee"

title: As a User, I would like to send an Add C out for e-signature through email
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC/Club

Wire:
https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=submit_mnc_for_email_e-sig
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking the esign button from an Add C
custom_expected:
THEN  a modal prompting the user to choose how the document will be esigned by each party (Player, Club Signatory) will launch
AND  The two options for players: In Person (will follow current flow), and Email
AND Each of these fields will be pre-populated with the primary email and primary phone number from the players profile
AND Each of the fields will be editable
AND  There will only be one option for Club Signatory: EBIS (will not be editable, as depicted)
AND When all required fields are complete, the Continue button will become active
AND Clicking Continue will bring the user to the esig confirmation modal, as depicted in the wire
AND There will be a cancel button on this modal
AND Clicking the cancel button will dismiss the modal without taking any action

title: As a user I do not want to be able to send an Addendum C for e-sig if a country other than the United States is selected for location signed
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* There should be a rule check added to sending an Addendum C for e-signature that if the location signed is set to anything other than United States, the user gets a hard error. 
* The error should read "E-signature is not supported outside of the United States."

title: As a Club user I want the player to be able to e-sign an Addendum C that includes an Addendum F
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Sending an Addendum C for e-signature that contains an Addendum F will appropriately generate the Addendum C and Addendum F and be available in the Player Signature widget, and also available for signature from the Addendum C. (like it is now)
* When the player goes to sign the Addendum C now, there will be two places the player is required to Sign.
* The Date field will be populated on the Addendum C as well as the Addendum F.
* The document will not be considered fully signed by the player until both the F and C are signed.

title: As a Club user I want the player to be able to e-sign an Addendum C that includes an Addendum G
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Sending an Addendum C for e-signature that contains an Addendum G will appropriately generate the Addendum C and Addendum G and be available in the Player Signature widget, and also available for signature from the Addendum C. (like it is now)
* When the player goes to sign the Addendum C now, there will be two places the player is required to Sign.
* The Date field will be populated on the Addendum C as well as the Addendum G.
* The document will not be considered fully signed by the player until both the G and C are signed.

title: As a Club user I want the player to be able to e-sign an Addendum C that includes an Addendum F and an Addendum G
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Sending an Addendum C for e-signature that contains an Addendum F and G will appropriately generate the Addendum C, F and G and be available in the Player Signature widget, and also available for signature from the Addendum C. (like it is now)
* When the player goes to sign the Addendum C now, there will be three places the player is required to Sign.
* The Date field will be populated on the Addendum C as well as the Addendum F and Addendum G.
* The document will not be considered fully signed by the player until the F, G and C are signed.

title: As a Club user I want to apply a Club Signature stamp to an Addendum C that includes an Addendum F
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* When an Addendum C that contains an Addendum F has been fully signed by the player, it appears in the Club Signature widget.
* Clicking "Stamp Signature" with an Addendum C selected that contains an Addendum F should apply the Club Signatory's signature in BOTH of the places required, as well as populate the date signed for the Club Signatory in both of the required date fields. 
* Once the Club Signature's stamps have been appropriately applied, the attachment is present on the Addendum C with the file label of Addendum C. 
* The Addendum C is appropriately submitted to the BOC for approval just as though the Addendum C did not contain the F. Because the F will trigger a flag, this will never be auto-approved. 
* The BOC user should be able to approve the Addendum C and the approval stamp should be applied to the bottom of the pdf.

title: As a user, I want the existing esign disclaimer found on Addendum Cs and NODs to also appear on the new F & G Pages
custom_steps:
The disclaimer is as follows:
"By providing my electronic signature and selecting the Submit button below, I accept these terms and conditions as if physically signed by me in writing."
